newsitem.title: USA: Cincinnati Bell up amid secondary offer.
newsitem.headline: Cincinnati Bell up amid secondary offer.

text.p: Cincinnati Bell Inc's stock rose on Thursday as its executives hawked a secondary stock offering, a company spokesman said.
The phone company's shares jumped 3-7/8, or 7.4 percent, to 56-1/4 in early afternoon trade. Cincinnati Bell announced last month it had filed for an offering of five million shares.
A registration statement said about two million of the shares, owned by the Cincinnati Bell Pension Plans Trust, were to be sold in the offering.

Another three million are held by a subsidiary of The Western & Southern Life Insurance Co. The offerings do not increase the number of shares outstanding nor will they generate any proceeds for the company.

Company executives have been carrying out presentations to spur the offering. The cause of the rise "is probably simply the fact the we are out telling our story to large institutional investors," spokesman Wayne Buckhout said.
